intro: Pentacalia almironcillo, commonly known as the Almironcillo morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and climbing plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and tend to trail or climb. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
